Name: Virgins
Description:
In Virgins you play the Lord of two villages, and as Lord you choose which villagers stay and which villagers travel to other player's villages. Adding fuel to the fire, a Dragon has taken up residence near by!

The Dragon has agreed not to burn down your villages if you sacrifice Virgins to it (bit of a stereo-type, that). For the good of your villages you've got to keep your Virgins uh, virgins.

So send any Strapping Youths, the Bad Boy, and that smooth singing Musician off to another player's village! Don't forget to keep the Sheriff in a friendly village to keep the peace and if you can, make sure the Bartender only gets the Blacksmith drunk!

If there are no virgins to sacrifice at the end of a round the dragon does what dragons do best. Burning down your villages and gobbling everyone up even you Lords!

Name: Blaze The Cat: Fire & Safety Rescue Game
Description:
This is an educational game designed for children ages 5 and older. The game "teaches children and families about different types of fire equipment and their uses. Additionally and most importantly it shows that it is always better to be a Team Player."

Each kid is represented by a Blaze The Cat firefighter token. The board represents a 10 story building with 8 rooms or stairways on each floor. The players race to the roof and then jump into the rescue helicopter. The first player to reach the top is the winner but all of the children board the chopper at the end of the game... nobody dies.

The cards are intended to teach lessons about courtesy, safety, and the things firefighters do in an emergency. Players roll dice and draw cards to move during a turn. Some reading will be required unless a parent or older child reads the cards.

Includes 4 tokens, 70 cards, a die, a colorful board, and the rules.

Name: Quantum Legions: Vanguard
Description:
The publisher's blurb:
Quantum Legions™ is a game of science fiction ground combat — or more specifically, a series of games simulating battalion-level conflict within the universe of the Thirteen Provinces.

Innovative command and combat mechanics allow players to quickly and easily fight out any number of battles of varying sizes, keeping the focus on tactics rather than rules. Though designed as a "hex-n-counter" board game, Quantum Legions can easily be adapted as a miniatures wargame. Details on how this can be accomplished are provided in the rulebook.

Finally, like most Majestic Twelve products, Quantum Legions includes rules for creating your own units so you can add to its exciting background, simulate your favorite movies and television shows, or create your very own universe!

Quantum Legions: Wargaming on an Epic Scale.

Additional Details:
Units are represented by counters with basic information (movement, range, attack dice, etc.) Players roll 2d6 for the number of command points available at the beginning of the turn. Command points are used to remove suppression markers, activate ordered units and place orders on units to activate on future turns. Combat is bucket of dice with the target number depending on the attack order and number of dice modified by the target's terrain.

The PDF includes five 11"x17" map sections. Two map sections are used in the basic scenario. Also included are 1" unit counters and 5/8" order and suppression markers.

Name: Epidemic Express
Description:
Epidemic Express is a lightweight solitaire dice game, where you are battling severe outbreaks of five deadly diseases. Your goal is to contain the diseases while developing cures for each. Meanwhile, worldwide panic is increasing, so you must act quickly before civilization breaks down completely.

Epidemic Express attempts to capture some of the flavor of Pandemic (an excellent cooperative game). It is *not* related to the older 2003 card game named Epidemic

You can choose to fight only real-world diseases, or you can use the optional zombie plague.

Name: City Campaign
Description: "City Campaign" is a 2-4 players family card game to simulate the Five Cities Campaign in Taiwan this year. Players choose to play the role of campaing manager of "Blue" or "Green" side. Each player receives 5 strategy cards in each round and there are five rounds in a game. Players will receive the information of the poll preference in each turn. You need to operate the four issues in the five cities to win more voter cards in the 5th turn. Players who wins more cities on the election day wins the game.

Name: URBAN-OPS: the card game
Description:
Urban-Ops: the cardgame sees two squads of soldiers/mercenaries fighting in an urban environment (namely, an industrial city called Horizon) , using all sorts of equipment (from sniper rifles, to short barrel shotguns; from GPS to jetpacks; from assault rifles, to medical kits, and so on) to try to win the fight.

The game has a very simple mechanic: after the players have chosen their squad (made of 6 different character, picked from the character pile, each with a specific background, image and abilities), they randomly place the locations (represented by cards) in which the fight takes place.

Then draw equipment cards, and, one at time, each player can perform, during his turn, the following actions:
1. draw up to 2 arsenal/equipment cards
2. equip up to 2 arsenal cards to the characters
3. move a character from a location to another
4. activate a character to use an equipped item

Once equipped, a card is used by rolling one D10: if the player rolls higher than the activation number (written on the equipment card), the item is successfully used, and players deal with its effects; otherwise, the card has no effect, and is discarded.
As simple as that.

But to give the game morespice, locations and character abilities give die roll modifications, so, for example, if you need to roll a 5+ to successfully use a rifle, but your character sucks at using ranged weapons, your roll will have  a -1 modifier, so you'll need 6+.

Modifiers will stack, so a bonus given by the character will add up to any bonuses or detractions given by locations, and vice-versa.

As if this was not enough, hidden among the arsenal cards, there are event cards, that, when drawn, make an event happen (from earthquakes, which will destroy a location, to spies, that will make one of your characters change faction; from swarm attacks, that will make characters loose their equipment, to the arrival of mercenaries that will add a new character to the opposing squad). These events are actually thought to discourage players from continually drawing arsenal cards, and to randomize things around.

Name: FLAGGO!
Description:
FLAGGO! is a trivia game about different countries around the world.
From the company website:

This gripping, educational ride is full of discovery and will expand your horizons as you fly round the world.

It calls for general knowledge, strategy, memory, skill and luck, and it covers a diverse range of subjects, including geography, art, sport, music, history, science and literature. These are just some of the things that await you! Players are fully engaged throughout the game. FLAGGO! will appeal to people of all interests. It will become like a good book, and you and your family and friends will want to return to it again and again.

Name: Dinofroz Survivors
Description:
Two teams of dinosaurs battle each other. Battle occurs when two dinosaurs are next to each other. Then the players spin tops to see who wins the battle. When one side is completely eliminated the game is over.

The dinosaurs are collectable and randomly sealed in eggs.

Name: Animal Mastermind Towers
Description: In this exciting vertical version of MASTERMIND designed for kids, players secretly stack their animals into a tower. By asking yes or no questions, they skillfully try to get inside their opponent’s mind. The game can be played at three different levels. The first player to break the code of his or her opponent wins!  Your favorite animal friends like pigs and bunnies, furry monkeys and lions, and fish and crocodiles join you on this fun adventurous game.  Winner of the prestigious 2010 Top Fun Tillywig Toy Award!  Check out the video featuring Animal Towers on ABC News Hottest Fall Toys.
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Peter Pan

Name: KLOO
Description:
Using foreign word cards players must discover the meaning of words and place them in sentences to score points and chase each other around France or Spain on the way to the capital. The game uses sophisticated Discovery Learning Techniques to make language learning faster and a lot more fun.

With KLOO you can in fact play 16 different games. Some are quick-fire quizzes. Others are akin to classic card games like Rummy, Whist and Patience. Players immerse themselves in the game of their choice but quickly learn a second language as they play. KLOO is currently in English to French and English Spanish.

Name: Showboat
Description:
For the first time ever, the world’s Top 5 Boat Racers have gathered for an intense competition, and you’re there 
to cheer them on! Place your bets and let the regatta begin! You love your favourite racers and they love their fans. 
The harder you cheer, the more they love you and thank you for your support!

There’s just one catch – being the SHOWBOATs they are, they actually stop to show you their appreciation! The more people cheer for racers, the more they show off, and the more they show off, the slower they go! Every time you cheer on a racer, they’ll slow down; but cheer on the leading racer, and you’ll get rewarded! Remember, it’s not just about cheering – you also have bets that you want to win! Can you use your cheers and your influence to impact the outcome of the race and go home with the most money?

Name: Cootie Card Game
Description:
A Cootie-themed deck of cards for children.  There are 6 colors (suits) of 7 body parts: body, head, eyes, mouth, antennae, left legs, right legs; plus 2 "I'm the Cootie" cards.  Rules are included for: 
- Build A Bug: draw until one player gets all his color parts.
- You've Got Cooties: an Old-Maid game.
- Squash the Cootie Bug: like SlapJack, but trying to collect all cards.
- Catch A Cootie: like Spoons, pass cards until you get a complete Cootie of one color.

Name: A la carte: Dessert
Description:
An expansion for A la carte that introduces new gourmet desserts for avid gamers including Spice Dice, Salty Dogs or the fiery Pomitos Frititos.

This expansion contains 4 mini expansions for A la carte and the components necessary to add a fifth player.


     Menus


Before the game starts each player receives 3 menus and chooses one. He doesn't let the other players know which menus he/she has. If a player successfully prepares the dishes on the menu, at the end of the game he/she receive extra victory points. Otherwise he/she gets no extra points. For some of the menus the player also needs at least one star.


     New Coffee Cups


Two new coffee cups are added to the game
- Trash can: Instead of choosing a dish from the table, a player can choose a dish from the trash can and place the dish in his/her pan.
- Flavor neutralizer: The player chooses a spice (even salt) from his/her pan and removes it from the game.


     Salt Dishes


There are 5 different salt dishes. The salt dishes are placed along the other dishes. The dishes are cooked as normal, only salt is needed.


     Spice Mixing


This is a new spice bottle that has 5 grains of each of the 4 different spices inside (for a total of 20). There is no salt in this bottle. A player can choose this bottle to add spices to his/her dish.

Name: Conqueror of Century's End
Description:
This is man to man combat simulation game based on "Fist of the North Star", is Japanese Manga/Anime.
Each player control one character from story. Each character is shown with a metal miniature. They make the most of various Techniques corresponding to their battle styles.

A player decides Technique to use when the begining of each turn. The movement rate and battle ability of that turn depend on chosen Technique.
The movement is pre-plotted and then executed on the movement board simultaneously. The battle action is select battle chits secretly and then executed on the battle board simultaneously.
The purpose of most scenarios is to knock down a opponent character.

Name: Fist of the North Star
Description:
This is man to man combat card game base of "Fist of the North Star", is Japanese manga/anime.
Each player control one character from story. A battle is done by the card play in battle royal form. 
Various techniques of the battle styles that it appeared with a combination of the card and the dice can be used. 
The player who survived to the game end is a winner.
Families: Characters: Fist of the North Star

Name: Drake's Ambition
Description:
This is self-published strategy level wargame based on Japanese TV animation "Aura Battler Dunbine".
This game cover war between Ciela side and Drake side in the world of Byston Well.

A player manage a treasury, and assigns it in the development of the weapon and the military operations. 
A game purpose is to ruin the country of the opponent side.
The turn order of the military operations depends on a chit-pull system. The performance of the weapon and pilot's and captain's ability influence a battle greatly.

Components (Second edition)

    1 rulebook
    462 counters
    1 map (A3 size)
    5 national administration sheets
    1 game administration sheet
    1 reference sheet

Name: VITP variant: Story of the Eight-Eight fleet
Description:
This is expansion kit for Victory in the Pacific based on Japanese fictional war novel "Story of the Eight-Eight fleet".

Predominance to the battleship of the aircraft isn't proved in this imaginary world. Because of that, the main force of the Pacific war is not an aircraft carrier but a battleship. It plays except for the added battleship, and a few rules as well as the original game.

Name: Trucker
Description:
Ruthless game about speed and hours of fun with a 30 ton diesel.

Goal of the game:
The aim of this game is to be the first to deliver all the parcels from your warehouse to the correct addresses. The first to do so and return to his warehouse wins the game.

Gameplay:
- Each player gets shipment cards in the beginning of the game. These define the deliveries that have to be made.
- On the board there is a road network with 4 delivery points.
- Each turn, players roll the die to determine how far their truck moves on the game board. Then they move their truck, trying to deliver their goods at the correct delivery point.
- When a truck ends on a telephone, the player must take a phone card; phone cards provide additional instructions for the player.

Box contents:
- 1 game board
- 1 die
- 4 trucks
- 19 phone cards
- 22 shipment cards:
  - 16 regular
  - 6 express
- rules

Name: Romance of the Three Kingdoms Expansion Kit
Description:
This is expanshion kit for Romance of the Three Kingdoms.
Add 80 leader units, army units, event cards, mini map, extend and optional rules.
Families: Theme: Romance of the Three Kingdoms

Name: Nooks
Description:
Nooks is two-player abstract strategy game of area enclosure. The standard game is played on a regular hexagonal game board, divided into hexagons with 8 hexagons to a side. Players take turns placing walls in an attempt to enclosure small areas called nooks.

A wall is created by placing four stones on four empty cells that are aligned and connected, forming what is equivalent to a straight tetromino.

A nook is an enclosed area which can not contain a wall. An area can be enclosed by wall stones and/or the edge of the board.

Players get to place scoring stones in each cell of each nook created during their turn. The game ends when the game board is completely filled and the player with the most scoring stones on the board wins the game. Ties are not possible.

Name: AbraKIDdabra
Description:
Overview:
AbraKIDdabra is a card game of crazy spells and rules that you play on each other.  If you make three mistakes and get caught you are out of the game.  Last person left is the winner.

Basic Play:
Each player has two parts to their turn:
Part 1:  Draw a "Simon Says" card and answer the question or follow the directions.
Part 2:  Draw a "AbraKIDdabra" card and give it to another player.  That player must follow the directions on that card for the duration of the game.

Players caught not following the rules or "AbraKIDdabra" cards in front of them are marked for the mistake and must turn the appropriate card face-down.  When a player gets 3 marks or face-down cards, he or she is out of the game.

Published by Play All Day Games (makers of Curses!)

(information from the rules card inside the game.)

Name: Battlestar Galactica: The Board Game – Exodus Expansion
Description:
Fantasy Flight Games is pleased to announce Exodus, the second expansion for Battlestar Galactica: The Board Game! With three new options to add to your game, Exodus is a great way to expand on the accusations and mistrust that runs rampant in Battlestar Galactica.

You can choose to add any combination of the three new options included in Exodus. Crave more white-knuckle space dog-fighting? Incorporate the Cylon Fleet option. The Conflicted Loyalties option introduces new Loyalty Cards that will test even the most trustworthy allegiances. Finally, relive the emotional turmoil of the hit television series with the Ionian Nebula, which pits players against the various conflicting personalities aboard Galactica.

The Cylon Fleet option keeps the pressure intense by introducing the Cylon Fleet game board. This board makes sure that every Crisis Card drawn will result in some sort of enemy ship activity. Once the Cylon Pursuit Track reaches the end, the Cylon ships will transfer over to the main game board, surrounding Galactica. There’s little time for rest between assaults, so get out there and protect those civvies, fighter jockeys!

Alliances are put to the test in the Conflicted Loyalties option, where the new Final Five Loyalty Cards up the stakes and introduce penalties for revealing your fellow humans’ Loyalty Card. In addition, new Personal Goal Loyalty Cards present players with an incriminating task to undertake. If they don’t fulfill their goal, then they will cause Galactica to lose a resource at the end of the game. Will you raise suspicion by completing the damaging task, or will you lay low and hope your failures won’t condemn the rest of your crew?

Finally, with the Ionian Nebula option, familiar faces populate the fleet as allies, and can be encountered by visiting locations on Galactica. But beware! The Cylons can influence these non-player characters, compelling them to produce negative effects when encountered. Manage humanity’s conflicting personalities carefully... or infighting will leave you vulnerable!

Name: Lost Souls
Description:
From the publisher's website:
"According to ancient Mayan legend, a representative is chosen from the human race to play the Game of Lost Souls against the gods to guarantee that mankind passes into the new world.

The game is a battle of wits, strategy and luck. Understand your opponent’s choices and make wise ones of your own. The fate of humanity rests in your hands."

In this two-player game, points are scored by moving their 6 pieces to the center of the board. Each of 6 pieces have a different ability. Combat is a simple roll-off system, with powers modifying.

The game is not sold separately but comes with the young adult novel, Lost Souls: Burning Souls.

Name: Zooloretto: Octopus
Description:
Expansion for Zooloretto or Aquaretto, given for free by Abacus at Essen 2010.

Playing the game:

Please use the original rules with the following exceptions: the first player who fills his 6-space enclosure (Zooloretto) or places the sixth tile in one of his basins, takes the enclosure with the Octopus as a bonus* and places it below his zoo board, near his barn (Zooloretto) or near his water zoo board (Aquaretto). He immediately earns 4 coins, which he takes from the bank and must predict the player with the most points at the end of the game. If he is right, nothing happens. Otherwise he must pay back 2 coins. For each coin he cannot pay back he gets -1 point. Afterwards - as usual - the player with the most points is the winner. The Octopus enclosure remains with this player until the end of the game. The player may place no tiles in the Octopus enclosure.

*If Octopus is played with Grizzly, Polar Bear, and / or other similar expansions, the players filling their 6-space enclosures may select these enclosures in any order they want. If played with Aquaretto the player earns also a coin as usual.

(taken from the card)

Name: Grand Cru: Heuriger und gemischter Satz
Description: Two expansion tiles(three times each as the original improvements) offered at the booth of the "Östereichisches Spielemuseum" at Essen 2010. These replace two of the eight types of improvement available in the game adding additional variabilty.

Name: Fresco: Expansion Modules 4, 5 and 6
Description:
Fresco: Expansion Modules 4, 5 and 6 consists of, as the name suggests, three additional expansions for Fresco! They can be played individually or combined with any or all other expansions for the game. These expansions are:


    4. The Wishing Well – Throw a coin into the wishing well and you will receive an extra benefit. You might find a purse in the theatre and receive a reward for its return, or a friendly marketer will present you an extra paint.



    5. The Gold Leaf – At some market booths you can receive gold leaf to intensify the shine of your paint. The bishop will be thrilled!



    6. The Glaziers – As an additional action, you can buy glass in different colors and build windows in the Cathedral. Even the plain-looking parts of the fresco will appear now in a dazzling light.

Name: Lifeboat Expansion #2: Liquid Courage
Description: From the package pack: This expansion adds 10 new cards including an eighth character - Madame Wong complete with a few extra navigation cards, love and hate cards and a few doses of the liquid courage card. You must have Lifeboat to play.

Name: Ordalie
Description:
Ordalie is a two player game in which they are knights who fight each other.

Both players have a deck of cards 1-12, at the beginning of a round each player discards two cards.  After this each player plays one card face down and then they reveal it together.  The highest card wins (with 2 exceptions).  And he hits his opponent.  Then the player has to choose in secret which part of his opponents body he will hit.  First he chooses from two cards (left and right) and then from three cards (head, torso, legs), giving him a place and a height to hit.  His opponent may try to defend and also chooses these cards.  Then they both reveal their cards.  If they both played the same cards, nothing happens, if their is no card corresponding then the opponent gets full damage.  When one card corresponds he gets 'half' damage.  He puts this on his damage board (left side head, right side head, left side torso, right side torso, left leg, right leg), On each is a score track when the score track reaches the maximum the fight is lost.  If no maximum damage is obtained a new round starts (a fight takes 3 rounds maximum.

Name: Fzzzt! Expansion Pack
Description:
The Expansion Pack for Fzzzt adds material for a 5th and a 6th player and 8 cards for the conveyor belt deck.

So the exansions consists of:
4 starting cards for the 5th player
4 starting cards for the 6th player
8 conveyor belt deck cards: 2 production units, 1 Fzzzt, 1 robot upgrade, 4 robot cards

In a 5-6 player game there are only 4 auction rounds instead of 5
(12 cards in the conveyor belt rather than 8 in the standard game)
In a 2-4 player game one can choose a longer game (6 auction rounds instead of 5) by adding the 8 additional cards to the conveyor belt deck.

There are no important changes in the rules.

Name: Stronghold: Heroes
Description:
From the leaflet that comes with the game:

Instead of using the two standard heroes from the base game (the Officer and the Warrior), the Defender can choose to draw two random heroes from among the ten new ones available in this expansion.

The expansion is 10 heroes (5 Double-faced Cards )in a zip lock bag and an A5 size sheet of rules.

Name: Relics
Description:
Publisher:

The whims of a spoilt king can cause nations to crumble... but the arrogance of the ancients could split the world in half. Some seek decadent comfort in the pain and suffering while others pound the drums of war to fight the oppression. Where will your adventures take you?

Relics is tabletop wargame set on the unique world of Relicia. Supported by a range of models in the 30mm scale (where a models of a 6 foot tall person would be 30mm tall from the base of the models foot to the models eye). Each of the races of Relicia has a highly distinctive feel; both in terms of look and play.

Name: ASL Open '96 Scenario Pack
Description:
At the ASL Open in 1996 the Windy City Wargamers issued a full color ten scenario pack.

Will to Fight... Eradicated has the SS attempting to stop a Polish counter-attack in house to house fighting in Poland 1939.

Scotch on the Rocks has Scottish Highlanders trying to dislodge German infantry from a hilltop as the battle for Tunisia begins to wind down.

Tigers at Merefa features a mixed German force of Tigers and Panzergrenadiers attempting to silence a Russian artillery position near Kharkov in 1943.

Cat Becomes the Mouse depicts a German attempt to bypass a British position in an armored slugfest during the D-Day invasion.

Abandon Ship has a weak American infantry force attempting to delay a combined arms German attack force during the Battle of the Bulge.

Los Ejercitos Nuevos pits the Republicans against the Nationalists during the Spanish Civil War.

Eye of the Tiger has a desperate group of Germans tanks and infantry counterattacking Russian combined forces as Operation Bagration winds down.

The Last VC in Europe depicts a local German counter-attack against British forces in Germany with less than three weeks left in the war in Europe.

Sweep Up has a frozen German relief team trying to re-open a supply route at the height of the Russian counter-offensive at the gates of Moscow in 1941.

Stand And Die features a combined arms conflict in the Chapei province in China as the Japanese attempt to dislodge the Chinese defenders in 1937.

Name: Roshambo Champion
Description:
A free single-player print-and-play, this game is less about actual rock-paper-scissors and more about being in a crooked Rock-Paper-Scissors (Roshambo) tournament!  Exploit your opponents' weaknesses while working around your own crippling disadvantages. When that doesn't work, cheat or bribe the officials!

The game PDF is available in the files section, or can be downloaded from here.

Gameplay:
In this game you generate some simple stats for yourself, then face opponents like "The Copycat", "The Randomizer", and "The Cheat" in a simulated blind ladder-style elimination.  Which opponents are dangerous and which ones are pushovers will be different every game.  When the going looks too rough, either cheat to give yourself an edge or bribe the officials to change the lineup and hope the opponent you dodged gets eliminated before they match back up with you.  But don't get carried away... you don't have enough money and sneakiness to fix every match.

Name: Professor Noggin's History of Art
Description:
Learn to appreciate the highest achievements of civilization. Professor Noggin's series of educational games encourages kids to learn interesting facts about their favorite subjects. Each of the thirty game cards combines trivia, true or false, and multiple choice questions about the history of art.

Card topics include:
Leonardo da Vinci
Michelangelo
Sculpture
Painting Techniques and Materials
The Renaissance
Italian Renaissance
Rembrandt
Monet
Picasso
Impressionists and Post-Impressonists
World Architecture
Ancient Greek and Roman Art
Ancient Egyptian Art
Mary Cassat
Byzantine Art
Baroque
Rubens
American Art
Canadian Art
Modern Art
Musee de Louvre
Art Museums of the United States
Andy Warhol
Who Am I?
Name This Masterpiece

Name: Professor Noggin's Presidents of the United States
Description: Learn about the important people who helped shape and lead the United States. Professor Noggin's series of educational games encourages kids to learn interesting facts about their favorite subjects. Each of the thirty game cards combines trivia, true or false, and multiple choice questions about the presidents of the United States.

Name: Professor Noggin's Baseball
Description: Learn all about one of North America's favorite past-times. Professor Noggin's series of educational games encourages kids to learn interesting facts about their favorite subjects. Each of the thirty game cards combines trivia, true or false, and multiple choice questions about the history, rules and traditions of baseball.

Name: Professor Noggin's Hockey
Description: Professor Noggin's series of educational games encourages kids to learn interesting facts about their favorite subjects. Each of the thirty game cards combines trivia, true or false, and multiple choice questions about ice hockey.

Name: Alien Frontiers: Matter Extractor
Description: This small expansion for Alien Frontiers consists of two alien tech cards named either Space Crane or Matter Extractor, depending on which edition you own. In either case, the card allows you to steal four fuel/ore from the stock or take an alien tech card from the alien artifact instead of stealing from other players.

Name: Seikiheikuu
Description:
This is a strategic level wargame for 3 to 7 players based on Three Kingdoms era in the Chinese history.
The game title "sei ki hei kuu" is Japanese pronunciation of "æ—Œæ——è”½ç©º" (Mandarin Chinese pronunciation is "jÄ«ng qí bì kÅng"). This phrase means "many (military) flags obscure the sky". This phrase is quoted from "Former Ode on the Red Cliffs" by chinese poet Su Shi.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Former_Ode_on_the_Red_Cliffs

Player control one warlord in the end of Han dynasty.
The turn order of player's operation phase and common administration phase is decided at random.
Leaders ability influences diplomacy and military operations greatly.

The player who controls many provinces is a winner at the end of the game.

This game is supplement of Japanese Tactics Magazine #39, and die-cut counter was sold separately.

Name: War of Retribution: Atlas of the Narn-Centauri War
Description:
This is an expansion for Babylon 5 Wars, first edition.

Information taken from the back of the book

Included:

    Maps detailing fleet movements during the war.
    Statistics for 36 ships fighters and bases
    Sew rules covering space stations, skin dancing, miniatures rules, flint (electronic intelligence) vessels


From the publisher:

This details the conflict fought between the Narn and Centauri during the second season of Babylon 5. Maps of the war, scenarios and expanded ship lists are included, along with new weapons such as the mag gun, guardian array, ion torpedo, matter cannon, and burst beam. Over 30 new ships, fighters and bases are provided, from the mighty Centauri Octurion Battleship to the lowly Narn Sha'Kos Police Cutter, as well as new ship classes like Missile Frigates, Scouts, Escorts, Carriers, Strike Cruisers, Supply Ships, and more!

Name: Spearpoint 1943: Village and Defensive Line Map Expansion
Description:
Expand your copy of Spearpoint 1943 and Spearpoint 1943 Eastern Front with Frontline General: Spearpoint 1943 Village and Defensive Line Map Expansion! This expansion requires the cards from either base game of Spearpoint 1943 and adds new depth to the system, new situations with fictional intros by Mark H. Walker, beautiful Marc von Martial artwork, large die-cut 1" general counters and 4" terrain tiles, printed rules/situation booklet, quick reference and score cards, and a gorgeous two-sided mounted 12"x36" Village / Defensive Line map inspired by 1943 Italian summer and winter terrain.

Features


     Take the fast-paced fun of the original two-player 30-minute World War II squad-level tactical card game Spearpoint 1943 to a whole new level!
     Play new tense tactical Standard Games and Situations that set up differently every time using versatile die-cut terrain tiles such as buildings, ruins, minefields, bunkers, trenches, and more!
     Expansion includes new Situations with fictional introductions by Mark H. Walker.
     Beautiful Marc von Martial (cogwheeldesigns.com) component and box artwork.
     Adds simple new rules to the Spearpoint 1943 system including movement, line of sight, combat within buildings and structures, artillery spotting, and more!
     Adds more tactical challenges for players through new well-tested Situations.

Name: Dune: Variant Cards
Description:
A set of 8 new Dune Treachery cards printed on 1 sheet of cardstock with 2 pages of accompanying rules.  These names and effects have precedent in the books or movie, primarily the books.

The cards are: Weather Scanner, Smuggler, Troop Carrier, Dust Chasm, Juice of Sapho, Imperial Conditioning, Break Imperial Conditioning, Weirding Way.

These were published in The VIP of Gaming Magazine, Issue #2 Feb/Mar 1986

				
				
					Summary of EffectsWeather Scanner: Allows a non-Fremen player to examine the next weather token.
Smuggler: Steal spice from another player, stealing more for each desert territory you control.
Troop Carrier: Make a second shipment of troops to Dune, paying the Guild as usual.
Dust Chasm: Destroy all non-Fremen units in the space where a Spice Blow just occurred, and no units may move into or through the space this round. Fremen units which stay in the space will also be destroyed. Can't be played if a worm appears.
Juice of Sapho: After a player has committed their cards to a battle, look at the entirety of their remaining hand before making your own choice.
Imperial Conditioning: For one battle only, before players have committed cards to a battle, your leader cannot turn traitor.
Break Imperial Conditioning: Cancel Imperial Conditioning when it is played in your battle.
Weirding Way: Before any part of a battle occurs, play to double the casualties that battle inflicts on your opponent.

				
				
					Suggested UseFive cards without effects are included in the base game, and two more 'useless' cards are added in Dune: Spice Harvest and Dune: The Duel. This variant suggests replacing those seven cards with the first seven of the variant cards, and to, once someone has blown the Shield Wall, replace the Family Atomics card with Weirding Way and/or have that card function as Weirding Way.

An alternate method suggested is to buy an additional full set of Treachery cards and overwrite the normal effects with the variant card effects (pasting the new image onto the card, or for a more modern audience, using sleeves and inserts).

				
				
					Interaction with other ExpansionsThe 'Reviving the Ghola'/Bene Tleilax expansion adds additional uses for the 'useless' Treachery cards. If the variant cards replace useless cards and that variant is also in use, they should be marked to indicate that they also count as 'useless' cards for the Tleilaxu's purposes. The alternate method is probably preferable if these are used together.

Name: Era Of Inventions: The Golden Goal
Description:
The Golden Goal is a small expansion for the game Era of Inventions.  The expansion adds some wealth to the success of those who are ambitious, but also helps those who have bad luck in being a successful inventor!

Materials: a golden token
Preperation: at the beginning of the game, place the golden token on square 5 of the influence track

Rules: the first player who reaches or passes by square 5 gets directly 1 golden coin, and the player (or players) who are lowest on the influence track directly receive 1 cube of free choice (white, purple, grey, black or blank) out of the general reserve.

After these bonuses, the golden token is immediately placed on square 10 of the influence track, after which the same rules as above are applied.  At any way, after the golden token has been reached it is moved 5 squares further on the influence track (so, from 5 to 10, from 10 to 15, from 15 to 20, and so on).

source: from the rulebook

Name: Survive: Escape from Atlantis! – The Giant Squid Mini Expansion
Description:
There has long been a debate in the scientific community: Which creature is mightier, the Whale or the Giant Squid?  At long last, you can decide! The Whale and the Giant Squid are pitted against each other here in battle! But wait… Will they attack each other?  Or will they attack your poor escaping people and their boats?  Let the battles begin!

In “Survive: The Giant Squid” mini-expansion for “Survive: Escape From Atlantis!”, players add an additional creature, The Giant Squid… and it is hungry!  With its long tentacles, The Giant Squid can not only reach into boats to attack people, but it can also reach onto land to chomp on people, making your opponents’ people on land vulnerable as well!  The Giant Squid adds a whole new twist to the great game of “Survive Escape From Atlantis!”

NOTE:  You must have the base game Survive: Escape from Atlantis! to enjoy this expansion. The Giant Squid pieces may be added into the base game with the rules contained in this mini-expansion.

Name: Mis Pecados... El juego de la verdad
Description:
In this game you have to say if its true or not, some sex related actions printed in the cards.
Depending on each card you'll have to drink a beer, change your place to someone else, move forward to the score table, etc.

For example a couple cards:

"I've never seen porn" If you say True, you have to drink, if you say False, you don't have to answer next question.

"I've never cheated on someone" If you say True, move 1 forward, if you say false, tell us with who and when!!!

Name: Bamogo
Description:
Abstract Two-Player Game. Each player tries to connect two sides. The 16 playing pieces  have three colours, 5 of two colors and six for the third.

Players either put two stones with different colours on adjacent places on the board or switch the position of two adjacent stones.

A connection can be made with any colour. First one to make the connection wins.

Name: Towers of Illusion
Description:
Look!... Now Look Again! What you see (or don't see) determines your path to the top! Science Art magic and philosophy are intertwined in the "seeing" of visual illusions. Towers of Illusion examines perception through dozens of visual oddities. The accompanying text carefully explains the dynamic of each illusion, so players are entertained and educated. With more than one way to play, this game delights children and adults.

Game Mechanics:

Roll the die and move your Jester accordingly. If you land on a step with a path symbol on it, take a card and read the question on the front of the card out loud. Answer the question. Depending upon what you see in the optical illusion at that moment, turn the card over and follow the directions based upon what you saw. Do the game when landing on a step with a key symbol. When you reach the top of the tower, you obtain a treasure coin. Obtain three treasure coins (one each of the three types of treasure coins) and win.

General Information:

It appears that the game was sold through the Museum of Fine Arts Boston, MA.

Contents:

Three Towers, Six Jester Player Pieces, One Die, 18 Treasure Coins, 198 Optical Illusion Cards and on the back side of these cards are the Key Cards (66) and Path Cards (132), 18 Lose a Turn Cards, 18 Extra Turn Cards, Eight Clips to Hold the Towers Together

Name: Catan Geographies: Austria
Description:
Catan Geographies: Austria, a.k.a. Die Siedler von Catan: Österreich Edition, is the fourth in a series of  regional map expansions for the venerable Settlers of Catan line.

The rules of the Austria Edition are closely to those of standard Catan, with a few departures to keep things interesting. Players may build cities only in the round intersections denoting actual cities. Because some of the cities are only one hexside apart, the spacing rule requiring two roads between settlements is not in effect. Roads can be built only on the printed spaces; when a space is printed in red, then this road is equal to a trading-harbor (3:1 trading)

Name: Mutterböhnchen
Description:
Latest Addition of the Bohnanza-series for 2-6 players. Only playable with Ladybohn: Manche mÃ¶gen's heiss!
The set consist of 33 new cards: 
8 babies 
24 special male cards (2 of each kind)
1 counter card

The cards can be used to exchange and "spice-up" the base game as the male beans (such as the Chauvinist Pig or Slacker) bear conditions on them which can alter the game play.
2 regular cards are replaced with "mama's beans".
For Example: The Chauvinist Pig (a Saubohne, of course) only lets the lady beans be below the bean field.  The metrosexual lets them get up front immediately.
The Bachelor discards all babies to the discard pile.
Those cards can really alter the gameplay.

...and then there's the Attack of the Little Rascals!

Name: Minotaurus
Description:
Players must prove their adeptness at somersaulting bulls. They do that by performing the somersault in five steps.

Left and right horn stones of varying colours and values are used in a type of Memory game to collect matching pairs of horns. These pairs symbolise the height of the somersault. Higher values mean greater skill.

Players can challenge each other by trying to throw a ring over one of the horns of a bull sculpture.

Victory goes to the player who has the highest jumps at the end of the game.

Content of the box:

     50 playing stones and 1 horn sculpture made of THETA stone
     one leather ring
     one rulebook


Source : translated from publisher's website

Name: The Arian Controversy
Description:
The Arian Controversy: A Game of Heresy and Hilarity is a light strategy game for two players.  Set in the early fourth century AD, one player takes on the role of Arius, attempting to gain support for his position that Jesus was not equal to God.  The opposing player takes the role of Alexander, bishop of Alexandria, and attempts to convince the world that Jesus was equal to God.  Players must move quickly around the board, spreading their message across Europe, the Middle East, and Africa.

On their turn, players draw two cards, each of which has a certain number of action points.  Using one card for action points, players move around the board and lay down support cubes.  The other card is stored away, to be used at the Council of Nicaea. 
Players debate at the Council of Nicaea with the cards that they've put away in order to gain further support for their position.  
Once all cards are discarded, the player with the most support wins, and the opposing player is labeled a heretic.
The Arian Controversy: A Game of Heresy and Hilarity brings all of the tension and name-calling of early Christian controversy to the comfort of your living room!

Name: Mörderische Dinnerparty: Totentanz auf der Titanic
Description:
The Setting: North Atlantic, April 14 1912. The Titanic, the largest and most luxurious ocean liner of the world makes headway through icy waters. Lord Wellington, favourite of the ladies, is on board. He has just recently bought a mysterious jewel at auction: "The Eye of Shiva" which allegedly is cursed. One night the Lord is found dead in his cabin. Did the Indian god's revenge strike him down, or was it one of his illustrious fellow travellers from 1st class?

Das Thema: Nordatlantik, 14. April 1912. Die Titanic, der größte und luxuriöseste Passagierdampfer der Welt, bahnt sich seinen Weg durch das eiskalte Wasser. An Bord ist auch Lord Wellington, Liebling der Damenwelt. Erst vor kurzem hat er ein sagenumwobenes Juwel ersteigert “ Das Auge Shivas“, auf dem angeblich ein Fluch lastet. Nun hat man den Lord tot in seiner Kabine gefunden. Hat die Rache des indischen Gottes ihn niedergestreckt? Oder war doch einer seiner illusteren  Mitreisenden aus der 1. Klasse der Täter?
Families: History: The Sinking of the Titanic

Name: Rattus: Spiel 2010 Bonus Cards
Description:
Released in october 2010.

Contains:
- Joan of Arc: she disguised herself as a man in order to be able to join in the 100-years war. In this game she is therefore able to act as other personalities. 
- Count Dracula: Being one of history's most blood-thirsty rulers, Count Dracula gets extra points for killing other players. 
- Robin Hood: he steals from the rich (the player with majority) and gives to the poor (himself...).
- Merlin: as a top-ranked magician the legendary Merlin is able to use his skills to manipulate the plague.

Available through:
- Essen 2010 Show * purchase of the Pied Piper expansion in the White Goblin Games booth 5-01 in Hall 5 *

Name: Hossen
Description: HOSSEN! is a tactical cardgame in which players each form a "Polonaise" (a dancing pair or group) using different party guests. Not all guest are compatible with each other and your Polonaise can be disrupted and extended in several ways. A winning Polonaise is always unique and because disrupting other players lines and cards is all in the game, the game requires some sharp wits. The last round always comes unexpected, making every play unique

Name: Constructing and Piling Zoolino
Description:
Back of the Box: Who can bring order into the chaos of the animal paradise? Two color die games introduce children in a child-friendly manner to their first games with rules.

The game can be played in two variants "3,2,1 - collecting fun!"and "No trace of the animal".

In the first variant the animals are build up in the center of the table at the start of the game. In turn the players roll a color die and take a building block in the corresponding color. The player who gathers the most blocks wins.

In "No trace of the animal" an animal of three different colors is build for each player. Now the players try to deconstruct the animal top to bottom by rolling the correct color. The player who finishes first wins the game.

Name: aufRUHR!
Description:
In the strategy game aufRUHR!, the players represent mayors who compete with one another while also needing to cooperate to improve the general state of a unified Ruhrstadt and to realize the most valuable projects. The overall goal of the game: Becoming the new Paramount Mayor of a unified Ruhrstadt, and bringing together the 53 towns of the Ruhr region.

The game board is unusual in that it's an irregularly shaped jigsaw. Each player can place developments on adjacent spaces and stand for election by all the players to become temporary paramount mayor. (You cannot vote for yourself.) The successful candidate gets a paper hat to wear and can reward different sorts of developments – which might affect the election next term. Players can use bribes (which score victory points for the recipients) or the threat of scandal to induce other mayors to collaborate with them. Money takes the form of coal – as the Ruhr region contains a significant coal field.

aufRUHR! was developed as a project by architecture students at the Berlin University of Art as part of the Ruhr being the European capital of Culture 2010 and was published in a limited edition in time for Spiel 2010. (Essen is one of the cities of the Ruhr.)

Name: Valdora: Special board 19
Description:
A Valdora promo tile for Essen 2010

The special board is placed next to the game board. As long as it is next to the game board it can be claimed by discarding different-colored craftsman tiles. At the game end, before scoring, the player that collected the special board is allowed to take one extra turn after the last player finished his turn.

Name: Fresco: Expansion Module 7 – The Scrolls
Description:
Exclusive expansion module October 2010, Essen, Spiel 2010:

The bishop presents the painters with some extraordinary scrolls. With the help of these chronicles of the elder masters, the players now can restore the fresco according to his fancies and earn extra victory points.

(from rulebook)

Name: The Phantom League: Mostly Harmless
Description:
Game description from the designer:

For the heroes of space lanes, Dragon Dawn Productions has something new to offer: the first expansion for its 2010 title The Phantom League called Mostly Harmless.

This expansion will include new cards for pretty much every deck (docking, improvement, battle, captain, mission, ship and hyperspace). The new cards will extend the game play of the base game and differentiate more between the path of fame and notoriety.

Mostly Harmless also includes reprints of the most "broken" cards of the original game and a new and improved English-language rulebook that covers both the expansion and the base game.

Name: I.Q. Games: Inventors and Inventions
Description: User summary: Like the other games in the "I.Q. Games" series, this game consists of a deck of cards, each card listing an "answer" (in this case Inventors and Inventions).  There are 35 cards, and each card has art depicting the inventor and their invention on the front.  Players take turns guessing.  The "reader" starts with the first of the 5 clues. Answering correctly on the first clue gets 5 points.  Each subsequent clue is 1 point less.  An educational trivia game that has game-play flexibility, allowing for normal play, solo play and team play.

Name: Luna Llena: Death Moon
Description: Expansion to Luna Llena. Including 6 new pack cards for the Werewolf player, 3 new hexagons, a "chainsaw" special item and 15 special abilities distributed randomly to all characters at the beginning of the game for being used once in the game.

Name: Asara: Das Haus des Flaschengeistes
Description:
This expansion will be played together with the master variant of Asara. The players who decided to choose the "House of the genie in a bottle" have one wish free.

The players have to pay the stipulated price and can then choose one action of one of the other areas.It is not important whether the other areas are free or occupied.

Name: Peloponnes: Athens-Mini Expansion
Description:
Background:
The competing city-states can barely survive on their own. Now it is possible to receive aid from Athens, which, of course, brings its own disadvantages.

Components:
Athens-Tile
2 Athens-Chips

Name: RuhrWeiber
Description:
Translation of box back:

Did you know...
which woman from the Ruhr area was the first to drive a car around the world? Why the DFB used to forbid woman soccer teams? What Tana Schanzaras real name was? Or what a "Mutterklötzchen" is?

The female side of the Ruhr area: The game invites you to rediscover the history of the Ruhr area. All aspects of women's history with women in society, art, culture, economy, politics are made accessible in a playful manner. The game offers exciting questions regarding historical and contemporary women from all social domains, introduces women's groups, highlights "female" events and opens up places connected with women.

Includes four different rules to play.

Name: Inrah
Description:
The Inrah box contains a set of cards similar to Tarot cards. It can be used as a roleplaying supplement (to play out card reading), but also to play Boltan which is a Poker variant. Due to the different number of suits and cards in each suit, the probabilities of hands are different from Poker, so the hand ranking was adjusted.

Translation of box back:

Inrah - the card game from the world of The Dark Eye: 121 playing cards that can be used for the Aventurian card gambling game Boltan and also for fortune-telling. 49 "Great Arcana" show themes from Aventurian mythology, 72 cards in six suits show the houses of the elements (from Ace to Seven, Squire, Knight, Prophet, Wizard and Prince). Includes booklet with interpretation hints and layouts for card reading as well as instructions for different Boltan variants.

Illustrations by Caryad and Mia Steingräber.

Name: Tembisa
Description:
From the back of the box: Tembisa is a unique combination between card and dice game that allows you to play three different games which are all based on Africa and its adventures.

The three different games are:
1. Tembisa, the treasure hunt
2. Tembisa, the African farms
3. Tembisa Memory

The game materials consist of 1 die, 4 wooden pawns and 56 playing cards. Besides a startcard and finishcard (showing the treasure in a cave), the cards show different situations you come across (e.g. a hungry lion, a wild river, a giant snake, friendly villagepeople). Each card also shows a negative number, STOP, or 1 or 2 dice to roll.

1. Tembisa, the treasure hunt
A line is laid out of the playing cards. All cards, except for the start and endcard are placed facedown. A player rolls the die and moves his or her pawn accordingly. If the card where the pawn ends is not face upwards yet, do it now. In either case: this card shows a picture of what you met, together with a it's effect on your pawn: move it accordingly. (The number of places shown backwards, STOP or roll 1 or 2 extra dice.) The card where pawn ends up has no further effect for that players turn.
When six uncovered cards are in a uninterrupted row, this region is deemed fully explored. Only the positive cards keep their effect.
The player to reach the endcard showing the treasure first, wins the game.

2. Tembisa, the African farms
For this variant, the start and end card are not used.
Players try to build the biggest farms. A farm is build by placing a -1 card on the table. This farm can be enlarged by placing a -2, -3, ... on top in order.
A player is allowed more than one farm, all starting with a -1.
The STOP and 1 and 2 dice cards are used for protecting and stealing cards from the other players: to attack play a stop card on anothers farm, depending on further STOP or dice cards, a dice duel commits between attacker and defender. If the attacker wins he or she robs a die roll of cards from the top of the attacked farm. These must be used immediatly to enlarge his or her owns farm(s) or be discarded.
A STOP card can also be used to protect one farm. When placed on top a farm of your own, that farm is protected against robbings. However, you cannot enlarge it anymore either.
Players hold six cards in their hands, drawing 1 extra at the start of ones turn. This can be a card from the drawpile, or the top one of the (open) discard pile.
At the end of ones turn cards are discarded or taken to fill up to 6 cards.
STOP and dice cards are removed from play once used. 
Gameplay continues till there are no more cards in the discard and drawpiles. (The discardpile is reshuffled and becomes the new drawpile each time.) Then the values of the farms are added for each player, the player with the largest farm is the winner! (Just count as if each card had a positive number, instead of a negative.) Cards held in hands don't count.

3. Tembisa Memory
A variant on ye old Memory. The goal is to make pairs of cards. The STOP cards count as jokers, it can form a set with any other card. However, two STOP cards are not a set!
The 1 die and 2 dice cards are also jokers, but also give a number of bonus points at the end of the game: roll one or two dice accordingly for the number of bonus points.
Scoring: The values of the couples are counted, dice bonusses are added. Player with the most points wins the game.

Name: Shake Shake
Description:
Shake Shake is a board game using three-dimensional tetromino blocks.

On a turn, place one of your blocks onto the playing area, keeping in mind that the circular plate will shake once you're finished, so you need to place it with care. Blocks must be placed to fill the bottom row first; if you don't have a block to fill the bottom row, you can place a block on the top row. If the next player can fill this empty space, they must do so. If one or more blocks tumble off the plate on your turn, set them aside next to you.

The game ends one of two ways: Either a player knocks off three or more blocks at once, or everyone has placed all of their blocks. In either case, score points to see who wins. To do so, view the tower from above and count the number of blocks in your color that are visible, then subtract 1 point for each dropped block in your possession. The player with the most points wins.

Name: Heimat-quiz
Description:
Translation from box leaflet:

It is very simple. 100 important questions, 100 right answers. One asks the question, the other gives the answer. Who picks the right answer from four possible choices keeps the question card. Then the next player has his turn. The one with the most cards at the end has proven himself to be a true "Niederrheiner" [Lower Rhine resident].

Name: Tank Attack! Board Game
Description:
A light "Wargame" played on a board made by hexagonal tiles randomly placed on the table.

The hexagons represent different kind of terrains (plains, hill and forest) and player try to conquer them in order to attack the enemy's HeadQuarter.

Players army is composed by small plastic tanks, a trademarked gaming piece by Editrice Giochi.

Combat is resolved rolling special dice.

From the box:

Tank Attack! is a strategy and conquest game. Each player has an army made of "Carrarmatini-EG" (tiny tanks), with which he will try to conquer the General Headquarters of the other players, eliminating them. The scope of the game is indeed to be the last player left in the game. Tank Attack! is played on a battlefield made of hexagons that represent the various land types which are placed on the table, always in different manner. The battlefield will be different at each game and therefore you must learn to adapt your strategy to the different game situation, exploiting at best the characteristics of the land on which the battle will take place.

Name: Tank Attack! Card Game
Description:
Presented at Lucca Games 2010 by Editrice Giochi.
Tank Attack! Card Game is for 2-6 players.

Content:
A fleet of tanks and flags are useful to keep track of the points scored by the players during the game. The big ones 5 points, small one 1 and the flags 10 points.
A tin box to contain tanks and flags.

"The United States have been invaded by an unknown enemy. The players must free the inhabitants of the 50 American States, one at a time, playing the cards in their hands strategically."

110 cards: 50 "States" and 60 "Tanks". 50 States represents 50 States of US and each card indicates the name of the state, its position within the USA, the flag, the geographic boundaries and a value which is proportional to the actual number of inhabitants of each states.

How to play.
The first "states" card is turned and represents the objective of the current hand.
Each player choses one card among his 5 "Tanks" cards, when all players have chosen their cards, the cards played are revealed.

The player who plays the card with greater value wins the State.
The value of the state represents the score obtained and who won this card take relative number of tanks and flags and placing in front of him.

The game ends when all the States are freed or when one of the players reaches a pre-set score that varies according to number of players.

The Tanks cards are discarded and replaced by other cards.

Integrated Risk: a new complete set of fleet of a new color give option to add a new player to Risk.

Name: Spellbinder
Description:
Spellbinder - The Domino Word Game

An Absorbing Pastime for Children age 5-12

Complete words by adding to your opponents' dominoes.  Be the cleverest 'Spellbinder' and the first to use all your pieces.  A game for 2-4 players.

Source: box

Name: Inca Empire: Bonus Sun Event Cards
Description: A mini-expansion for Inca Empire, containing four new Sun Event Cards: Quarelling Gods, Fame, Road Planner and Earthquake.

Name: "Thanks a Lot!?"
Description:
The "What do your friends really want?" Game

A getaway in southern France, 24 hours of invisibility, or bring one animal back from extinction which do you want the most? Thanks A Lot.? is the lively game of giving and receiving where it’s truly the thought that counts. Dole out amazing gifts to your family and friends based on what you think they’ll like. The higher someone ranks your gift, the more points you score. (from the manufacturer)

Name: Orado
Description:
Abstract two-players-game on a leather-plan (which you can tighten to a little bag) and with semi-precious stones as counters.
Both players have 13 counters, 8 in one and 5 in another color. The board has 13 fields. During the game, the players "color" the fields with their stones, at the end every field has one of four possibilities of stone-combination.

To win, you want to create less equal color-combinations in adjacent fields than your opponent.

Name: Raupenrallye
Description:
In Raupenrallye, you want to be the first to get your seven caterpillars from one side of the apple to the other. On the apple game board are two lines of holes, with the lines crossing at the core and with each line having three holes on either side of the apple.

On a turn, you roll the four-sided die, and (if you don't roll a 4), you move one of your caterpillars that many spaces, either from the start area next to the game board or from wherever it is on the game board. If you land a caterpillar on the core, you move it immediately to the goal space off the game board. If you do roll a 4, roll the dice again; if you once again roll a 4, you must return one of your caterpillars on the board to the starting space; if you roll anything else, then you can move a caterpillar from the starting space to the core, then an additional 1-3 spaces depending on what you rolled.

If you manage to fill all three spaces on one half of a line with your pieces, you immediately move all three pieces to the goal.

Name: Junkyard Races Character Cards
Description: Character cards to use with the Race-Kart Crew optional rule (see pages 17 & 18 of the rules booklets). Best used to randomly determine who gets which character

Name: Encounter
Description: User summary: Each player is dealt five playing cards. A turn consists of playing a card, following the cards instructions and, if possible and desired, buying a space on the game board. Certain spaces on the game board are common areas. They are considered to be owned by everyone and occupied by no one. The object of the game is own a path of spaces connect any side of the board to one directly opposite.

Name: Quills
Description:
In Quills, players use letter cards to form the best word – that is, the one worth the most prestige points – that they can. The words are critiqued, with the fewest critiques going to the most prestigious word. After ten rounds, the player with the fewest critiques wins.

If you can't make a long word, you can instead try to make one that ends in a string of cards of the same suit (a "meld").  Because the game combines word-forming skills with other pattern formation, a player's obscure vocabulary will help but not guarantee a win against players with more conventional vocabularies (but an eye for long melds).

Name: The Cyanide and Happiness Karma Boardgame
Description: A simple game similar to Snakes and Ladders. It is free and anyone can print it out and play it. The players take turns at throwing the die and move their character the number they rolled. Whoever makes it to hell last wins.

Name: Mad Monks
Description:
In the Monastery of Bierbrau, the monks brew their famous ales which are sold all year round to keep the church coffers full. The monks are normally forbidden to drink their own beer, except on their ‘night of madness’ - Verrücktheitsnacht, where one special barrel is marked by the Abbot for consumption by the monks.

On this night all of the monks attempt to gain the barrel of beer from each other. They all claim not to want the beer for themselves, but merely to save their brothers from it. Once a monk reaches his cell, he may lock himself in and safely dispose of the beer. Whatever happens during the night of madness will never be spoken of ever again.

Players roll two dice to move themselves (one when carrying the barrel or being watched by the Abbot), plus an additional die to move the Abbot. The winner is the first monk who can carry the barrel into his cell after it has exited the cellar, brewery, kitchen and refectory. Monks can attempt to chastise and berate each other to help themselves gain the upper hand, or the Abbot can berate another monk on their behalf.

Name: Multimedia Mad Gab
Description:
From the box: "The TV, movie and music game where it's not what you say, it's what you hear!"

This game is similar to Mad Gab but all of the answers pertain to TV, movies, or music.  Each card consists of a series of words that when spoken together or in the correct inflection sound like the target phrase.  Each turn, teams try to answer the most puzzles before the timer runs out.  Once the timer has been advanced to the end of the track, the team with the most solved puzzles wins.

Name: Juggler
Description:
From the publisher's website: "JUGGLER is a word game for 2 to 6 players, played on a table with a special deck of 70 alphabetic cards (one letter per card, with a score value - E is worth 1, J is worth 8 ...etc). The Juggler card deck actually consists of two decks, one of 22 vowel cards with red backs and faces, the other of 48 black consonant cards.

Object/Overview

"A game comprises several ‘rounds’. At the start of each round, each player is dealt just seven of the black consonant cards; the remaining cards are placed face down on the table as two decks (one red, one black). Players play in turns around the table in a clockwise direction. The aim is to build the best word you can in your hand by drawing and discarding cards. If you turn your whole hand into a word, you can then ‘declare’, which means you stop the round, hoping to catch the other players with valuable cards they can’t use.

"After a player has declared, everybody else has just one more turn in which to make the best of their hand. When play comes back round to the declarer, all the players place their hand of cards onto the table, announcing their word for that round and scoring the total face value of all the cards they have used for their word (MINUS the total face value of any remaining unused in their hand). The scores for each round are recorded on paper and when any player’s running total hits 70 or more, the highest total wins. "

Name: Five Men Standing
Description:
You're poised on the emerald pitch at Eden Park for the Final of Rugby World Cup 2011. It’s the dying moments of the game. The score is deadlocked and the crowd is screaming. The ball is passed out to the back line: the outcome hinges on what you do next!

Five Men Standing is for both lovers of the glorious game, and those who have never held a Rugby ball in their hands. Fast paced, competitive, and with no sissy turn taking, this is a game of frantic action and fun! 
 Each player controls a set of 5 Rugby players, drawn from 2 of the teams competing in the 2011 Tournament. How you manipulate, position, and toss these players will determine the ultimate victor.

--- How To Play ---
 Each player takes a team of five Rugby player figures in their hand, then yells:

Touch! Players cup their figures in both hands, then reach out and bump hands with their opponent’s
Pause! Players withdraw hands from their opponent’s
Engage! Players release their figures onto the playing surface

The figures will bounce around and land in one of four stances, from best to worst: Standing, On Side, On Back, Face Down in the mud.

Your aim is to yell Stop! when you think you have a combination that will beat your opponent.

If your first throw wasn’t great, don’t just sit there moping. This isn’t your grandma’s tiddly winks, this is Five Men Standing Rugby! Speed and skill count, so grab the figures you want to throw again and see if you can improve your combo. Just remember, you can’t pick up figures that are Face-Down in the mud. Those blokes are out of play.

And be fast, because your opponent will be doing the same and might yell Stop! first...

Combos are based on Poker, with a couple of twists, and are ranked on the provided Score Board.

If you win a round, you take a Rugby ball token. When they're gone, the player with the most tokens wins.

There's also Advanced Scoring Rules for Legends, solitaire rules, and you can add more players by buying more Country Team Packs.

Name: Technopoly
Description:
Technopoly is a promotional game produced to celebrate the 50 year anniversary of Ineel Institute. It is almost an exact copy of Monopoly with the following exceptions: There are fewer spaces, there are only Chance Cards (no Community Chest) and the Free Parking House Rule (in which players take all the money from the center of the board when landing on Free Parking) is an official rule in this version (called "The Jackpot").

As players move around the board they have the opportunity to purchase the deeds for places named after technological facilities of the Ineel Institute, such as "Fluorinel Dissolution and Fuel Storage Facility", "Stored Waste Examination Pilot Plant", "Experimental Breeder Reactor-II", and "Spent Fuel Storage Cask." The Chance cards also feature text related to Ineel including, "Pay Duty on International Waste Shipment Thru RWMC - pay $100" and "Conduct a Seminar on WFC - Collect $25 fee."

The game rules allow the game to end either at a set time or until only one player remains in the game.

Name: Mangrove
Description:
Mangrove is a dexterity game for 2–4 players.

The game consists of 29 wooden sticks of variable thicknesses, and an elastic plastic middle part. They have a colour at the top and at the bottom. The sticks are placed in a vase-like bowl, so the whole construction looks like a flower. The players pick a stick each, one at a time, but they have to pick a stick which top colour matches the bottom colour of the previous stick. If there is no sticks left of that colour, the player must pick a thick but valuable red stick. The player who causes the whole flower to fall apart loses automatically, and the remaining players count the points of their sticks; thin sticks being worth 1 and thick sticks 3 points. The player with the most points wins.

Name: Yonmoque
Description:
In Yonmoque players try to be the first to get exactly 4 of their pieces in a row. And no more than that... Get 5 in a row and you immediately lose the game!

Yonmoque applies the 'swapping mechanism' from Othello; opponent pieces that are trapped in between two of your own pieces are turned over so that they become your own. The differences with Othello are that you don't just place tiles on the board, you also move them around. Furthermore, placement and movement is determined by the colour of the squares of the board. There are squares in the colors of each of the players (white and blue), as well as 5 neutral squares. Given that there are less squares for the blue player (8 versus white's 12), the blue player always gets to play the first move.

Name: La fiesta de Dora
Description:
La fiesta de Dora is a memory-luck game for kids. In the game, Dora wants to celebrate her birthday party and it should meet her friends Boots, Tico, Benny, and Isa before taking the cake. Each player throws a dice that tells in what area of the board should look for the the visitors of his color. But if Swiper  appears on the dice, everyone will have to reach out and say "Swiper no swiping" to avoid he takes a pie.

La fiesta de Dora es un juego de memoria y suerte para los más pequeños. En él, Dora quiere celebrar su fiesta de cumpleaños y para ello debe reunir a sus amigos Botas, Tico, Benny e Isa antes de coger el pastel. Cada jugador lanza un dado que le indicará en qué zona del tablero debe buscar a los invitados de su color. Pero si aparece en el dado el zorro Swiper todos tendrán que extender la mano y decir "Swiper no robes" o se llevará un pastel.

Name: T'was A Night of Pandemonium: A Christmas Murder
Description:
From the publishers website:

A Santalicious Christmas Murder Mystery Party! A fun Christmas-spirited murder mystery party for 8-16+ guests ages 13 to 112! There is an expandable Elf character that can be expanded to as many optional characters as you need!

Mystery Synopsis: It was time for the annual pre-Christmas meeting at Mr. and Mrs. Santa Claus's home in the North Pole. This was the bustling time of the year when the Christmas workers needed to stop working for a moment and come together to discuss how Christmas was unraveling. The meeting attendees arrived as planned at Santa's home. They enjoyed appetizers and engaged in fun Christmas trivia questions while waiting for the meeting to begin. They had fun with an exciting game of 'What Christmas Thing am I' followed by a challenging game of Christmas Taboo. Mrs. Claus served a delicious dinner along with an entertaining Christmas Scramble challenge. The meeting was productive and the Christmas spirit was soaring high until to everyone's shock...a murder occurred! The Christmas characters all rallied together to figure out whodunit before this scandalous murder ruined Christmas! After everyone accused who they believed the murderer was...everyone came clean with their involvement in the crime and...the murderer confessed! While the group awaited the North Pole P.D. to arrive and arrest the accused, the group played a fun game of Christmas Charades. Overall, Christmas had its issues behind the scenes - but the nice boys and girls got their presents on Christmas morning according to plan.

home page: http://www.mymysteryparty.com/

Name: Bloody Crossroads: Gettysburg Day 1
Description:
Gettysburg: The Bloody Crossroads is the first title in Academy Games' "Fight for the Colours" trilogy of battles, each focusing on a separate day or area of the Battle of Gettysburg during the American Civil War.

The rules will be a cross between the Johnny Reb miniatures ruleset and the game system introduced in Conflict of Heroes by Academy Games. The brigade-level game system relies on unit counters, action cards, and a hex-based map  Players can substitute miniatures for the game counters if desired.


Full map of Gettysburg

Bloody Crossroads is a detailed simulation of day one of the Battle of Gettysburg, with twenty scenarios that include fast-playing smaller engagements up to the full northern half of the battle including Culps Hill, the town of Gettysburg, Evergreen Cemetary, Seminary Ridge and more.

Follow on games in the series will include Union in the Balance and High Tide, each focusing on separate areas of the battle including the Round Tops and adjacent areas that could have been used for flanking attacks and calvary fights that might have changed the history of the battle and the war.

Name: La France en 2000 Questions
Description:
From the game box:
A tour around the France, for ages 8 and above. Cities, regions, history, culture and it is all in 2000 not so hard, not so easy questions. Discover France on a beautiful game board and enjoy the high quality of the question cards in this trivia game for the whole family.
While playing, answer correct to collect amazing souvenirs (points) and bonuses to win the game. First one the collect 100 points is the winner.

Name: Godzilla!
Description:
Run back and forth gathering marbles while Godzilla spins around and tries to whack you with his tail!  Watch out, if you get knocked over you have to run back home before you can stand up and gather more marbles. Gawo Wowo!

Up to four players each use a hand crank to move their character back and forth on a fixed track, while Godzilla spins in circles sweeping colored marbles around a circular track. Each player tries to grab his or her own color of marble and haul it back to home base.  If knocked over by Godzilla's tail, the player looses any marble he is carrying, and has to crank his character back home to stand back up.

Name: Rehepapp
Description:
From the publisher:
This is expansion for the "Mees, kes teadis Ussisõnu". This one adds all new and well knows friends from a next book in the series "Rehepapp"

The game adds:
28 new card (8 landscape, 6 owl eggs, 9 enemies, 5 allies)

New rules:

Set-Up - Instead of 4 land tiles, add now all 8 tiles.
Each player gets to start now with one ally card.

Players - Adds 6th and 7th player rules.

Gameplay - won land tile replace with one from the deck.

New Special Cards:

KRATT - same as other enemies, but cannot escape! After wining becomes an ally!

SNOWMAN (land tile) - this one is without mission. Acts same as Meeme card in base game, but it only allows to move to snow and water tiles.

Name: Rock'n Roll
Description:
Um jogo de cartas de ritmo alucinante!

Para vencer é preciso descartar todas as cartas de sua mão. Seja esperto e aproveite para fazer com que os outros comprem cartas e você fique com a mão vazia. Na hora do Rock'n Rooll não deixe que os outros o ultrapassem e descartem as cartas primeiro. Com agilidade e inteligencia você consegue vencer o jogo. Diversão não vai faltar para quem joga Rock'n Roll.



O objetivo do jogo é esvaziar sua mão. Para tal, você deve sempre jogar uma carta com 1 número acima ou 1 abaixo ou com o mesmo número da carta anterior.
Quando entra em jogo a Carta Rock'n Roll, não tem mais ordem de jogo. Joga a carta quem quiser e tem que seguir o comando da Carta Rock'n Roll (jogar apenas cartas vermelhas, apenas pretas, etc.)



A fast-paced cardgame!You need to get rid of all card in your hand to win. Be smart and take the chance to force other players to draw cards while you empty your hand. When it's Rock'n Roll time, do not let the other players discard their cards first. You can win the game allying dexterity with intelligence. Leisure is guaranteed when you play Rock'n Roll.


The goal of the game is to get rid of all your cards. Each player goes in a clockwise direction and needs to play a card with a number that exactly 1 below, the same or 1 higher than the previous card.
When someone plays a Rock'n Roll Card, there's no order of play anymore, each player plays a card following the Rock'n Roll Card rule (only red cards, only black card, etc.).

Name: Ragnarok: Legend of the Galactic Heroes
Description:
This game is operational level wargame based on univers of the Legend of the Galactic Heroes, is Japanese science fiction novel/animation. This game represent invasion Free Planets Alliance by Galactic Empire called "Operation Ragnarok".

Two players move the ï½“ï½”ï½ï½’ fleets on the map which covers whole territory of the Free Planets Alliance. The purpose of the Galactic Empire player is the conquest of the alliance. The purpose of the Free planets alliance player is to crush the intention of the Empire.

As a story was so, the ability of the Admiral of Star Fleets influences a movement and a battle. A battle is resolved with the tactics chit choice and the Fire Power CRT. Various fleet tactics in the story are represent by the tactics chit choice.

Scale: 1 turn: 10 days, 1 hex: unknown, 1 unit: about 2000 space ships
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players
Setting: Legend of the Galactic Heroes

Name: Reindeer Races
Description:
